intro: Crateva tumulorum, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its fruit is a spherical capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. The plant is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
